t: Psalm 139
God’s Perfect Knowledge of Man
For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
O*pn Lord,*s You have searched me and known me.*i
You*ld know my sitting down and my rising up; You*ld understand my thought afar off.
You*ld comprehend my path and my lying down, And*ld are acquainted with all my ways.
For*ld there*i is*i not a word on my tongue, But*ild behold, O Lord,*s You know it altogether.
You*ld have hedged me behind and before, And*ld laid Your hand upon me.
Such*ild knowledge is*i too wonderful for me; It*ld is high, I cannot attain*i it.
Where*ln can I go from Your Spirit? Or*ld where can I flee from Your presence?
If*ld I ascend into heaven, You are*i there; If*ld I make my bed in hell, behold, You are*i there.*i
If*ild I take the wings of the morning, And*ild dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
Even*ld there Your hand shall lead me, And*ld Your right hand shall hold me.
If*ld I say, “Surely the darkness shall fall on me,” Even*ld the night shall be light about me;
Indeed,*ld the darkness shall not hide from You, But*ld the night shines as the day; The*ld darkness and the light are*i both alike to*i You.*i
For*ln You formed my inward parts; You*ld covered me in my mother’s womb.
I*ld will praise You, for I am fearfully and*i wonderfully made; Marvelous*ld are Your works, And*ld that*i my soul knows very well.
My*ld frame was not hidden from You, When*ld I was made in secret, And*ild skillfully wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
Your*ld eyes saw my substance, being yet unformed. And*ld in Your book they all were written, The*ld days fashioned for me, When*ld as*i yet*i there*i were*i none of them.
How*ln precious also are Your thoughts to me, O God! How*ld great is the sum of them!
If*ild I should count them, they would be more in number than the sand; When*ld I awake, I am still with You.
Oh,*ln that You would slay the wicked, O God! Depart*ld from me, therefore, you bloodthirsty men.
For*ld they speak against You wickedly; Your*ld enemies take Your*i name*i in vain.
Do*ld I not hate them, O Lord,*s who hate You? And*ld do I not loathe those who rise up against You?
I*ld hate them with perfect hatred; I*ld count them my enemies.
Search*ln me, O God, and know my heart; Try*ld me, and know my anxieties;
And*ld see if there*i is*i any*i wicked way in me, And*ld lead me in the way everlasting.
